text:
He knelt in the square. 

Tears filled his eyes. 

He kissed the filthy earth. 

“He's boozed,” a youth laughed. 

“Going to Jerusalem,” a workman added. 

“Quite a young man!” someone remarked. 

Raskolnikov felt their eyes. 

“I am a murderer,” he thought. 

He turned down a street, 

glancing at the Hay Market. 

There she was, Sonia, 

hiding behind a shanty.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov experiences a profound emotional moment of humility and connection to the world, kneeling and kissing the ground, before heading towards the police office.
